Required Texts

  • Fisher (2009a)
  • Richardson (2020a)

  • Eco (1986)
  • Welch (1993)

  • Althusser (1971)
  • Fisher (2009b)
  • Fisher (2021)

Viewing

  • Hwang (2021)

Week 7: Fandom

  • Baym (2015)
  • Baym et al. (2018)

Additional Recommended Readings

Semiotics and Media Theory

  • Barthes (1972)
  • Chandler (2017)
  • Hall (1980)

Ideology and Cultural Studies

  • Eagleton (2007)
  • Gramsci (1985)
  • Williams (1985)

Postmodernism and Simulation

  • Baudrillard (1994)
  • Jameson (1991)
  • Lyotard (1984)

Digital Culture and Social Media

  • boyd (2014)
  • Jenkins (2019)
  • Marwick (2013)
  • Tufekci (2017)

Feminism and Gender Studies

  • Butler (1990)
  • hooks (2000)
  • McRobbie (2009)
  • Mulvey (1975)

Race and Media

  • Bonilla and Rosa (2015)
  • Gray (2004)
  • Noble (2018)

Subcultures and Fan Studies

  • Hebdige (1979)
  • Jenkins (2012)
  • Thornton (1996)
Using Citations in Your Papers

When citing these sources in your papers, you can use the citation keys shown above (e.g., @fisher2009capitalist). The full bibliography will be automatically generated at the end of your document.

Library Access

Most of these readings are available through: - Canvas course site (PDF uploads) - Emerson College Library databases - Course reserves at the Iwasaki Library - Open access repositories (where indicated)

Bibliography

Althusser, Louis. 1971. “Ideology and Ideological State Apparatuses (Notes Towards an Investigation).” In Lenin and Philosophy and Other Essays, translated by Ben Brewster. Monthly Review Press.
Amalia Ulman, dir. 2020. El Planeta. Film. Holga’s Meow Pictures.
Barthes, Roland. 1972. Mythologies. Translated by Annette Lavers. Hill; Wang.
Baudrillard, Jean. 1994. Simulacra and Simulation. Translated by Sheila Faria Glaser. University of Michigan Press.
Baym, Nancy K. 2015. “Social Media and the Struggle for Society.” Social Media + Society 1 (1): 1–2. https://doi.org/10.1177/2056305115580477.
Baym, Nancy K., Daniel Cavicchi, and Norma Coates. 2018. “Music Fandom in the Digital Age: A Conversation.” In The Routledge Companion to Media Fandom, edited by Melissa A. Click and Suzanne Scott. Routledge.
Bonilla, Yarimar, and Jonathan Rosa. 2015. “#Ferguson: Digital Protest, Hashtag Ethnography, and the Racial Politics of Social Media in the United States.” American Ethnologist 42 (1): 4–17.
boyd, danah. 2014. It’s Complicated: The Social Lives of Networked Teens. Yale University Press.
Butler, Judith. 1990. Gender Trouble: Feminism and the Subversion of Identity. Routledge.
Chandler, Daniel. 2017. Semiotics: The Basics. 3rd ed. Routledge.
Dazed Digital. 2016. “Amalia Ulman: Meme Come True.” Dazed Digital. https://www.dazeddigital.com/artsandculture/article/23700/1/amalia-ulman-meme-come-true.
Eagleton, Terry. 2007. Ideology: An Introduction. 2nd ed. Verso.
Eco, Umberto. 1986. “Towards a Semiological Guerrilla Warfare.” In Travels in Hyperreality: Essays, translated by William Weaver. Harcourt Brace Jovanovich.
Fisher, Mark. 2009a. Capitalist Realism: Is There No Alternative? Zero Books.
Fisher, Mark. 2009b. “It’s Easier to Imagine the End of the World Than the End of Capitalism.” In Capitalist Realism: Is There No Alternative? Zero Books.
Fisher, Mark. 2021. “Lecture 1: What Is Postcapitalist Desire?” In Postcapitalist Desire: The Final Lectures, edited by Matt Colquhoun. Repeater Books.
Friedlander, Emilie. 2014. “Social Anxiety: Why Amalia Ulman’s Fake ’Middlebrow’ Instagram Is No Different from Yours.” The Fader, November 7. https://www.thefader.com/2014/11/07/social-anxiety-why-amalia-ulmans-middlebrow-instagram-feed-is-no-different-from-yours.
Giolo, Guilherme, and Michaël Berghman. 2024. “The Aesthetics of the Self: The Meaning-Making of Internet Aesthetics.” Cultural Sociology, ahead of print. https://doi.org/10.1177/17499755241229570.
Gramsci, Antonio. 1985. Selections from Cultural Writings. Edited by David Forgacs and Geoffrey Nowell-Smith. Harvard University Press.
Gray, Herman. 2004. Watching Race: Television and the Struggle for Blackness. University of Minnesota Press.
Hall, Stuart. 1980. “Encoding/Decoding.” In Culture, Media, Language: Working Papers in Cultural Studies, 1972-79, edited by Stuart Hall, Dorothy Hobson, Andrew Lowe, and Paul Willis. Hutchinson.
Hebdige, Dick. 1979. Subculture: The Meaning of Style. Routledge.
hooks, bell. 2000. Feminism Is for Everybody: Passionate Politics. South End Press.
Hwang, Dong-hyuk, dir. 2021. Squid Game. Television series. Netflix.
Jameson, Fredric. 1991. Postmodernism, or, the Cultural Logic of Late Capitalism. Duke University Press.
Jenkins, Henry. 2012. Textual Poachers: Television Fans and Participatory Culture. 2nd ed. Routledge.
Jenkins, Henry. 2019. Participatory Culture: Interviews. Polity Press.
Lyotard, Jean-François. 1984. The Postmodern Condition: A Report on Knowledge. Translated by Geoff Bennington and Brian Massumi. University of Minnesota Press.
Marwick, Alice E. 2013. Status Update: Celebrity, Publicity, and Branding in the Social Media Age. Yale University Press.
McRobbie, Angela. 2009. The Aftermath of Feminism: Gender, Culture and Social Change. Sage.
Mulvey, Laura. 1975. “Visual Pleasure and Narrative Cinema.” Screen 16 (3): 6–18.
Negra, Diane, and Yvonne Tasker. 2007. “Introduction: Feminist Politics and Postfeminist Culture.” In Interrogating Postfeminism: Gender and the Politics of Popular Culture, edited by Diane Negra and Yvonne Tasker. Duke University Press.
Noble, Safiya Umoja. 2018. Algorithms of Oppression: How Search Engines Reinforce Racism. NYU Press.
Rhimes, Shonda, dir. 2022. Inventing Anna. Television miniseries. Netflix.
Richardson, Allissa V. 2020a. Bearing Witness While Black: African Americans, Smartphones, and the New Protest #Journalism. Oxford University Press.
Richardson, Allissa V. 2020b. “Looking as Rebellion: The Concept of Black Witnessing.” 1 in Bearing Witness While Black: African Americans, Smartphones, and the New Protest #Journalism. Oxford University Press.
Richardson, Allissa V. 2020c. “The New Protest #Journalism: Black Witnessing as Counternarrative.” 3 in Bearing Witness While Black: African Americans, Smartphones, and the New Protest #Journalism. Oxford University Press.
Roberts, Martin. 2007. “The Fashion Police: Governing the Self in What Not to Wear.” In Interrogating Postfeminism: Gender and the Politics of Popular Culture, edited by Diane Negra and Yvonne Tasker. Duke University Press.
Sooke, Alastair. 2016. “Is This the First Instagram Masterpiece?” The Telegraph, January 18. https://www.telegraph.co.uk/photography/what-to-see/is-this-the-first-instagram-masterpiece/.
Thornton, Sarah. 1996. Club Cultures: Music, Media, and Subcultural Capital. Wesleyan University Press.
Tufekci, Zeynep. 2017. Twitter and Tear Gas: The Power and Fragility of Networked Protest. Yale University Press.
Ulman, Amalia. 2014. Excellences & Perfections. Instagram performance.
Welch, David. 1993. “The Conquest of the Masses.” In The Third Reich: Politics and Propaganda, 2nd ed. Routledge.
Williams, Raymond. 1985. Keywords: A Vocabulary of Culture and Society. Revised. Oxford University Press.

Filmography

Amalia Ulman (2020)

Rhimes (2022)

Hwang (2021)
